The Hunter Valley is well known rest and relaxation destination for hard working Sydney people, and a good destination for tourists who want a change of scene from Australia's largest city. The main industries in the Hunter Region are coal mining, agriculture, viticulture and wine making, tourism, horse breeding, electricity production, dairy farming and beef cattle farming. The Hunter Region is one of Australia's most famous wine-growing regions, known for both its red and white wine varieties.

value: Grape vines in the Hunter Valley

The Hunter Valley is a major
region. Tours of vineyards and wine tasting tours are a huge industry. A number of local operators run tours of wineries:

value: content=Gone Walkabout Safaris operate 7 days a week with guaranteed departures every day, picking up participants from their accommodation in Newcastle and Hunter Valley.
price=$115 per person with lunch or $99 per person if you purchase your own lunch.
content=Boutique Wine Tours run luxury (14 person max) day tours of the Hunter Valley wineries, picking up participants from their accommodation in Sydney.

content=This Cessnock based tour company offers wine tours. Half day tours are available, as are full day tours including lunch.

In addition, there are several tours that set off from
for day trips or weekend-long visits to the Hunter Valley wineries:

value: content=Red Carpet Tours run 18 person day tours of Hunter Valley wineries, including morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea. Participants are picked up from their accommodation in Sydney.

content=Wine Country Tours offer 8 person wine tours hosted by a winemaker with 25 years experience. The tour includes private cellar inspections, as well as morning tea and lunch. Participants are picked up from their accommodation in Sydney.
